Quick Start

This guide will help you get started with ToolCraft quickly.

Basic Usage

Python API

from toolcraft import hello

# Get a greeting message
message = hello()
print(message)  # "Hello from ToolCraft!"

Command Line Interface

ToolCraft provides a command-line interface for easy access to its functionality:

# Basic greeting
toolcraft --hello

# Get help
toolcraft --help

# Check version
toolcraft --version

Examples

Using the Python API

import toolcraft

# Print version information
print(f"ToolCraft version: {toolcraft.__version__}")

# Use the main functionality
result = toolcraft.hello()
print(result)

Command Line Examples

# Show help for all available commands
toolcraft --help

# Display version information
toolcraft --version

# Run the hello command
toolcraft --hello

Next Steps

  • Explore the API Reference for detailed documentation

  • Check out Contributing if you want to contribute

  • Read the Installation Guide for advanced installation options

Getting Help

If you need help:

  1. Check the API documentation

  2. Look at the examples repository

  3. Open an issue on GitHub

  4. Start a discussion on GitHub Discussions
